Panarici es apostema le qual nays dejos la ungla del dit pous de la ma o del pe, e fort leu nays en les autres ditz, e cum es prolonguat e la sua curacio es mens prezada, o es apostemat de apostema caut, o es corrumput, e gieta brac entro que corrodeys la razitz de la ungla, e fort leu corromp aquela tota, e fort leu perve la sua corrupcio al os entro que es a lu odor fetent, e es fayta la extremitat del dit lada, e la color de lu es fayta fusca.	Panarici apostema is the condition where there's an escape of pus from pressure wounds on either foot or hand due to infection and inflammation at joint areas that are left open without proper dressing, leading to a risk of developing gas inside the abscessed tissue. The treatment for this medical situation requires immediate attention as it involves debriding infected necrotic (dead) material from wounds along with antibiotics if necessary and specialized care in managing deep-tissue pus accumulation, which can result in further complications like osteomyelitis when the bone becomes involved. This condition typically requires extended hospital stays or outpatient follow-up to prevent recurrence of gas formation within abscessed tissues that are accompanied by a foul smell and dusky coloration indicative of poor healing conditions, underscoring urgent medical intervention is critical for these patients due to the potential severity.

Dislocacio es eyssiment de alcuna de las juncturas del sieu loc, per que es prohibida de movement, e es orrezada la figura del membre, e fa venir sobre le malaute dolors e lesios grans.
